snippet: Dunes protected several communities from catastrophic damage during Hurricane Sandy, while Long Beach, N.Y., which built no dunes, suffered $200 million in losses.
abstract: Long Beach, NY, which had resisted building dunes along its beaches because it blocked ocean view, suffers $200 million in losses from Hurricane Sandy; several other nearby communities that had built 15-foot-high sand barriers were spared catastrophic damage, proving that dunes are effective in blunting attack of surging waves and tides.

byline.original: By MIREYA NAVARRO and RACHEL NUWER

lead_paragraph: Dunes protected several communities from catastrophic damage during Hurricane Sandy, while Long Beach, N.Y., which built no dunes, suffered $200 million in losses.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, Dunes Prove They Blunt Storms
headline.main: Resisted for Blocking the View, Dunes Prove They Blunt Storms
headline.print_headline: Resisted for Blocking the View, Dunes Prove They Blunt Storms
